title: Schema for an Open Contracting Release

ocid.title: Open Contracting ID
ocid.description: A unique identifier that identifies the unique Open Contracting Process. For more information see: http://ocds.open-contracting.org/standard/r/0__2__0/#defining-a-unique-contracting-process

releaseID.title: Release ID
releaseID.description: A unique identifier that identifies this release. A releaseID must be unique within a release-package and must not containt # or / characters.

releaseDate.title: Release Date
releaseDate.description: The date this information is released, it may well be the same as the parent publishedDate, it must not be later than the publishedDate from the parent package. It is used to determine merge order.

releaseTag.title: Release Tag
releaseTag.description: A tag that helps to identify the type of data in the dataset. These may be used for advanced validation. Compiled must only be used in a record-package-schema.

language.title: Release language
language.description: Specifies the default language of the data, in ISO 639-1 codes see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The buyer is the entity whose budget will be used to purchase the goods. This may be different from the procuring agency who may be specified in the formation data.

planning.title: Planning
planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. This includes information related to the process of deciding what to contract for, when and how.

formation.title: Formation
formation.description: The activities undertaken in order to enter into a contract.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: Information from the award phase of the contracting process. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.description: Information from the contract creation phase of the procurement process.

performance.title: Performance
performance.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.

scheme.description: The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified.

uid.description: The unique ID for this entity under the given ID scheme.

address.description: An Address following the convention of http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard (from http://json-schema.org/address)

item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.

description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

classificationScheme.description: The classification scheme for the goods

otherClassificationScheme.description: If the classification schema was not in list, please specify

classificationID.description: The classification ID from the Scheme used

classificationDescription.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

unitOfMeasure.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms

valuePerUnit.description: The value per unit of the item specified.

date.description: The date the milestone is either due or completed (as specified by dateType).

dateType.description: Specify whether the date field is referring to a due date or a completed date.

attachments.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.

performance.title: Performance
performance.description: Information during the performance, or implementation stage of the contract.

transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract

transactionDataPackageURI.description: The link to the budget data package (called a budget data package, but includes budget and spending data), as defined by http://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package

transactionID.description: The ID of the item in the budget data package, which this procurement is associated with. https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md#required-fields-all-categories

transactionAmount.description: The amount of the transaction as described in the budget data package (https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md#required-fields-all-categories). This provides some redundancy, but does not give full context such as the currency, date of transaction etc. which should be retrieved from the budget data pacakge.

milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.

reports.description: Any additional reports that are part of the performance phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.

planning.title: Planning
planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender

budgetDataPackageURI.description: The link to the budget data package, as defined by http://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package

budgetID.description: The ID of the item in the budget data package, which this procurement is associated with. https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md#required-fields-all-categories

budgetAmount.description: The amount of the item in the budget data package, which this procurement is associated with. https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md#required-fields-all-categories. This provides some redundancy, but does not give full context such as the currency, date of transaction etc. which should be retrieved from the budget data pacakge.

publicHearingNotices.description: A list of notices of any public hearings on this contract

strategicJustificiation.description: A description of the rationale for this procurement

anticipatedMilestones.description: A list of anticipated milestones for the contract.

tender.title: Tender
tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.

tenderID.title: Tender ID
tenderID.description: TenderID should always be the same as the OCID. It is included to make the flattened data structure more convenient.

itemsToBeProcured.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

totalValue.description: The total estimated value of the procurement.

method.description: Specify tendering method as per GPA definitions of Open, Selective, Limited (http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm)

methodJustification.description: Justification of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.

selectionCriteria.description: Specify the selection criteria, by lowest cost,

selectionDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the selection criteria.

submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction

submissionDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method.

tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

clarificationPeriod.description: The period during which clarification requests may be made and will be answered.

clarifications.description: A Yes/No field as to whether clarifications were issued. Would expect clarifications to appear as amendments.

awardPeriod.description: The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.

numberOfBidders.description: The number of unique bidders who participated in the tender

numberOfBids.description: The number of bids or submissions to the tender. In the case of an auction, the number of bids may differ from the numberOfBidders.

bidders.description: A list of all the companies who entered submissions for the tender.

procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

attachments.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender.

award.title: Award
award.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

awardID.title: Award ID
awardID.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid), it need not be unique in the package. e.g. ocid ABC can have awardID 1 & awardID 2 and ocid DEF can also have awardID 1 & 2. But if it is a different award, ocid cannot have awardID 1 and 1 otherwise that will cause the data to be overridden when the record is compiled.

awardDate.title: Award date
awardDate.description: The date of the contract award.

awardValue.description: The total value of this award. There may be more than one award per procurement.

itemsAwarded.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

contract.title: Contract
contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).

contractID.title: Contract ID
contractID.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid), it need not be unique in the package. e.g. ocid ABC can have contractID 1 & contractID 2 and ocid DEF can also have contractID 1 & 2. But if it is a different contract, ocid cannot have contractID 1 and 1 otherwise that will cause the data to be overridden when the record is compiled.

awardID.title: Award ID
awardID.description: The awardID against which this contract is being issued.

contractPeriod.description: The start and end date for the contract.

contractValue.description: The total value of this contract.

isAmendment.title: Is this an amendment to the contract?
isAmendment.description: If true, then amendment information should be provided.

itemsContracted.description: (Optional) The goods and services in this contract. If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.

deliverables.description: Deliverables or milestones included in the contract.

signatureDate.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.

attachments.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract.

notice.title: Notice
notice.description: The notice is a published document that notifies the public at various stages of the contracting process.

id.title: Notice identifier
id.description: The identifier that identifies the notice to the publisher. This may be the same or different from the OCID.

uri.title: Notice URI
uri.description: A permanent uri that provides access to the notice.

publishedDate.title: Notice published date
publishedDate.description: The date this version of the notice was published. In the case of notice amendments, it is the date that reflects to this version of the data.

isAmendment.title: Is this an amendment to the notice?
isAmendment.description: If true, then amendment information should be provided.

justification.description: An explanation / justification for the amendment.

startDate.description: The state date for the period.

endDate.description: The end date for the period.

uri.description: Link to the document or attachment.

lastModified.description: Date that the document was last modified
